Water Clock: A water clock uses the flow of water to measure time. The water level in a container can be used to determine the time elapsed.
Pendulum Clock: A pendulum clock uses the swinging motion of a pendulum to keep time. The pendulum's motion can be used to determine the time elapsed.
Geocaching: Geocaching is a modern method of timekeeping that uses GPS technology. By placing a GPS device in a specific location, the time can be tracked and compared to the original time.
Biological Clock: A biological clock is a natural timekeeping mechanism found in many organisms. It can be used to determine the time of day based on the organism's internal rhythm.
Quantum Clock: A quantum clock uses the properties of quantum mechanics to keep time. It can be used to determine the time elapsed with great accuracy.
